d: data structures that represent an array of elements and are indexed and mutable.
data structures that represent a linear collection of elements and are not indexed or mutable.
a feature of vectors that allows each element to be accessed in a constant amount of time, regardless of its position in the vector.
a feature of vectors that allows the elements to be changed or replaced.
a procedure for creating a vector, such as vector.
a procedure for accessing an element of a vector, such as vector-ref.
a procedure for modifying an element of a vector, such as vector-set!.
